Hello,

I hope you are well.
The engineering team has finished the investigation process and is aware of a limitation affecting the EPP Client on older Windows versions, specifically Windows XP, 7, 8, outdated Windows 10 versions (those no longer supported by Microsoft), and Windows Server 2016.

This limitation stems from the refreshed OpenSSL library embedded and used in the current EPP Client. Due to this update, support for these older, unsupported Windows operating systems has been discontinued. These operating systems are also no longer supported by Microsoft.

For customers using these affected Windows versions, we recommend continuing to use EPP Client release 5.9.4.0. Please be aware that no new features will be backported to this older release.

We are in the process of documenting this known limitation and will include it in our User Manuals and Release Notes. We are also working with our Product and Technical Writing teams to ensure this information is clearly communicated.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding.

Please let us know if we can close this ticket now.
Have a nice day,

Netwrix EPP agent supports all CURRENT versions of Windows clients and Servers as listed on the Microsoft chart below that have not reached "end of service" with Microsoft:

Clients: Microsoft-us/windows/release-health/supported-versions-windows-client

Servers: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/release-health/windows-server-release-info
